summary: Hurricane Helene was the strongest storm of the 1958 Atlantic hurricane season. It formed east of the Caribbean islands and moved west, growing stronger. Helene became a Category 4 hurricane with winds up to 150 mph near the U.S. East Coast. Though it didn't hit land, it caused lots of damage. Strong winds knocked out power and communications in North Carolina, and there was one death. Helene also affected Canada, with heavy rain and strong winds causing property damage in Nova Scotia and Newfoundland. Overall, Helene caused about $11.4 million in damage.
title: Hurricane Helene (1958)
